args:
{
        "name": "Tack Line Torn",
        "description": "Tack Line Torn is a generative art project that takes the viewer on a visual journey through the chaos of a tearing sail tack line. In sailing, a tack line is crucial to the stability and direction of a vessel, and in this project, the once-reliable line is portrayed as it breaks apart in real-time. The piece is a representation of the unpredictable nature of life, as the path of fragmentation is unique with each viewing. The fragmented line symbolizes the loss of control and the fragility of stability, and invites the viewer to contemplate the beauty that can be found in the midst of destruction. Tack Line Torn is an immersive and thought-provoking generative art project that explores the themes of unpredictability, transience, and the beauty of chaos.",
        "artistName": "Phil Smith",
        "website": "https://tacklinetorn.com",
        "license": "MIT",
        "scriptLibrary": "p5.js",
        "scriptLibraryVersion": "1.0.0",
        "aspectRatio": "1"
      }

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

returns._traitNames: the human readable trait names contained in the artwork
returns._traitTokenIds: the token IDs of the traits the artwork contains
returns._traitTypeNames: the human readable trait type names
returns._traitTypeValues: the trait type values used by the generative script
returns._traitValues: the trait values used by the generative script

params._traitAmountsToBuy: amounts of each trait to buy
params._traitTokenIdsToBuy: token IDs of the traits to buy
params._traitTokenIdsToCreateArtwork: token IDs of the traits to use to create the artwork

params._traitTokenIds: the trait token IDs to create the artwork with

returns._artworkTokenId: the token ID of the newly minted artwork

params._artworkTokenId: the token ID of the artwork being decomposed

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

returns._0: uint256 the number of script strings

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

royaltyInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Returns how much royalty is owed and to whom, based on a sale price that may be denominated in any unit of exchange. The royalty amount is denominated and should be paid in that same unit of exchange.

returns._0: bool True if the interface is supported, otherwise False

params._tokenId: token ID to get URI for

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._scriptIndex: index of the script to update

locked.return: bool True if the project is locked, otherwise False

returns._0: bool True if the project is locked, otherwise False

artwork(uint256).notice: Returns info about the specified artwork token

buyTraitsCreateArtwork(uint256[],uint256.notice: Buys traits with specified amounts, and create an artwork in a single transaction

createArtwork(uint256[]).notice: Creates a new artwork with the specified trait token IDs The caller must own the specified traits

decomposeArtwork(uint256).notice: Decomposes the specified artwork token into the traits its composed of The artwork token is burned, and the token ID will never be reused The traits are transferred to the caller's address

lockProject().notice: Locks the project so that project configuration is immutable before the trait auction begins

locked().notice: Returns whether the project has been locked

projectScriptCount().notice: Returns the number of strings contained in the script array

projectScripts().notice: Returns an array of strings to be concatenated together to form the generative script

setTraits(address).notice: Sets the address of the Traits contract

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Returns whether the specified interface ID is supported by the contract

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Returns the URI of the specified token ID

updateScript(uint256,string).notice: Updates the script at the specified index in the scripts array

userNonce(address).notice: Returns the specified user's nonce, which is used to generate artwork hashes

userdoc.notice: Implements ERC-721 standard for artwork tokens, and provides functions for creating and decomposing artwork
